replies.body: WTF!? Riot makes 6 million dollars from a single skin in less than 1 month's time... JESUS CHRIST

This skin had a few extra things going for it.

1) It was made public knowledge that the money would go to Make-A-Wish. (The main reason I bought it)
2) It had a load of other goodies to buy with it. Loading boarder, Icons, etc.
3) It was the only time it would be available for purchase before becoming a very exclusive HexTech gemstone item.

The 6.1M figure is not normal for a skin, but as a community we should be proud of what we came together to donate.

And thanks Rito for all the hard work to make it happen!
thank YOU!

Hey! I was actually deployed overseas during the whole event and did not know about the event until it ended :(. I would totally buy it if any way possible, as Cho is my favorite and most played champ. I was wondering if there was such a way?

You were deployed over seas serving in the military I take it? Thank you very much for your service.

If at all possible, as much as I love this skin, I would ask Riot, if it is possible, could they transfer it form my account to yours? I bought it to support the charity, and if it can go one step further and encourage a member of our military that would make me immensely happy. I know its a long shot, but would this be something that can be done Bilby, Riot, anyone?
Welcome back! We're planning to bring it back as a gemstone skin in the future, so your best bet is to save your gemstones and get it when you've got enough. Sorry for that timing--
Hey i know its been 9 months already, but when can we expect that to happen?
Should be available by gemstones? so, up to chance i think, sorry man

Honestly, I do not play Cho'Gath, and I definitely don't feel good about owning things like a Border for a champion I don't *love*, but I bought the largest bundle as my "charity" budget that month. :)

Good on ya! I wish I had more money to give to buy the bigger bundle, but it sadly just wasn't possible{{sticker:sg-soraka}} 

But hey, I am glad I could at least buy the base skin!

Honestly, I'm pretty sure they still make a couple millions on every skin. I can believe that this skin's special circumstances made it bought 4 or 5 times more often than a normal skin, but I doubt this number could be as high as 20 or 30. Thing is, even 5 times less for an ordinary skin, that's still more than 1 million.
This skin also came with expensive bundles with icons and borders and if you take out the skin price the rest of the cosmetics came out be around 1400 rp in total
Personally speaking, I bought it despite never having played cho just to help out some
Nice!
Who would have thought that the scariest, most evil-looking skin would have such a good and wholesome background?
help the world; DEVOUR THE UNIVERSE
Lets go. I love when riot does charity. So Helpful{{sticker:sg-ahri-2}} .
{{sticker:sg-kiko}}
So when can we see this skin in Gemstone store?
GJ

Good stuff.

Hopefully the next time there is a Charity Skin, it's for AIDS and Herpes organizations. 
(if they haven't done that recently.)
This absolutely amazing and I thank Riot for doing such good in the world. It means that something like this can happen again. I love league even more now.
Dark Star Cho'Gath is such a cutie, so I bought him despite never playing him
Very amazing to see from the league community!! I'm not sure if this is the first time Riot has done something like this but it should be an annual event!

Wondeful skin, and I love Cho so that plus the combination of the bts that basically made me cry made this an instant buy. Loved it so much, blessings to Bryan, and I wish Riot would bring in more community members to help make skins, especially for the champs that aren't as popular (i.e. not good enough money makers, @Rito, #ZoeGetsANewSkinBeforeAurelionDoes)
This is both awesome and amazing! I was glad to take part~!
{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}} 6,1 millions
so proud
That’s incredible
but when will it be available again? I didn't know it was limited :(
The skin will be added to the Gemstone skins via Hextech crafting in the near future. You won't be able to buy it with RP.
{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}  VERY NICE!
How about you leave your petty feelings about an event to help introduce and include others, that are not male, into our community out of this charity post????????????
To be entirely fair, this was discriminatory to FtM transgender folks as well.  Js
if u read the post, it said exceptions, so hm
Out of curiosity, what did the OP say?
T'was a bad jab at the PAX "incident" regarding the panel room being ladies-and-others-only for four hours.

What a topical and insightful comment about a charity event from weeks ago! You sure do keep on top of things, ImABeast20fo7. To answer your question, the funds went to children and teens in low-income communities in Brazil, Chile, China, Russia, and Turkey, students and hospitals in Germany and Mexico, suicide prevention in Ireland, autism sufferers (there are four times as many men suffering from autism as there are women!) in Korea, mental illness sufferers in Australia, refugees in southeast Asia, cancer patients in Spain, physically disabled children in the UK, and, of course, the children that are part of the Make-A-Wish Foundation. So... nope!
Not to get involved, but I think you're behind on the current event being referenced.
Nah.

You can literally just select Quote under me...

And a decent chance of it being a "joke" is a shit chance.
A decent chance is a shit chance, ok.  Guilty until proven innocent I guess.
That's call LOVE{{sticker:slayer-jinx-catface}}

I like charities, and this another exception. However, don't try to make this an excuse for your lame behavior at the Pax event. Most people will remember that, and using this as an excuse will just make you look even worse.

But, this is a for a good cause, good job Riot, good on you. Credit shall be given when credit should be given.

{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}
